title: The Good, The Bad, and The League : 1/31 - 2/6
body:
The Good, The Bad, and the League: 1/31 - 2/6

Your weekly dose of server problem-os, NA League news, and other!

9.3 makes you love or hate Akali again, we’ve got a new loading screen, and there’s some new items in game. Take a gander before playing, or rush right into Ranked (we all know what happens…) 

**Follow-Ups:**

* Wrong Season Border should be fixed
* [Holler](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) if they’re not!

**Server Stuff:** 

Hey! Look! Nothing broke this week in regards to servers getting players in game properly!

**Game Stuff: **

Games show flex queue borders incorrectly (1/24, ~2 weeks)
A bug caused incorrect ranked borders to be displayed in different game modes. The fix required a full redeploy, so we bundled it in with 9.3 and should be fixed! Be proud and show off your Bronze Border!  

**Player Support Trend:**

With a new patch out, if you’ve got an issues updating, check the patching guide [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues). Also, if you’re running out of space, take a gander at /Riot Games/League of Legends/Logs/ and see if it’s larger than a gig. If so, you might want to nuke a few dozen... hundred logs. 

Morgageddon & Couch Commando

Looks like I'm not the only one with the random LP gain/loss change. Mine did a complete 180 as well, even with a 66% winrate.

Could you elaborate on the choices behind locking position trading? I just played a Yas game and was assigned mid and traded lanes with my top laner so that I could dodge a zed matchup (not that yas is bad into zed just didnt want that skill matchup) and once we won the game I found that the win didnt count toward my mid lp and was counted as top alone. While not the end of the world in terms of importance but I feel this is a poor side effect of the new ranked que, it punishes teams with better communication if your trying to climb in one roll.

Anecdotally one of my favorite things about League is the position mind games of dodging bad matchups and finding good ones so thats why this sucks extra for a player like me.

> Anecdotally one of my favorite things about League is the position mind games of dodging bad matchups and finding good ones so thats why this sucks extra for a player like me.

We're not the best team to answer that question, since we don't work on matchmaking at all (just keep the servers up that do matchmaking). You might have a more informed answer from the balance section of Boards. The best I can provide is that because you did in fact play top, you were increased in ranking due to where you were, instead of getting mid points for winning, when in fact you were in top lane.

Think if you did that 100 times in a row, traded mid for top, your team won, and still your mid score kept on going up and up and up and up. When you finally got to play mid again, you could be rated significantly higher than you actually are, where you'd be unable to compete without having the skills for that MMR (again, assumptions. For all I know, you're the next Faker).

Also having a really hard time climbing in the new ranked system. I'm losing more than I am gaining when it comes to LP. People say I have lower mmr than what I am supposed to be at, but if I can't get to the spot where I need to be in the first place, then its useless even playing ranked and trying. Especially when ranked is a full team game and the outcome is not only based on your level of playing in lane but everyone else's level of play. I don't really know what I can do, thoughts about this?

It feels like it's been harder to climb cause I'm experiencing alot of smurfs in my game which often alters the Tier Average. I got demoted to Plat 3 immediately and in that game was matched up against a Silver 4 smurf. The Tier Average for that was Gold 1. Maybe it's just too early in the season right now to be playing with the amount of people on their smurf accounts.

Maybe it's just too early in the season right now to be playing with the amount of people on their smurf accounts.

I would say anecdotally, the worst (or best depends on how you look at it) times to play ranked are right at the start of a season, and at the very end. You can get an extreme amount of variance in skill from players because it's the very beginning and everything's getting sorted out, and for the end, players are charging towards personal goals, possibly doing riskier trades/champ selections because they need to get just one more promotion with only 3 days left.

Usually, after a few patches, everything's settling down, and you should be playing against people who mathematically are where they should be in order to improve.

But does Riot understand the problem with this?  You made the "season" shorter by breaking it up into 3 parts.  Then you made moving tiers harder because we now have to play 5 times the placement games, 5 times the promo games.   LP Gains and splashing need to be doubled or tripled if we are to climb with all of our positions before the end of the 'split'.
there Change while playing Jungle gave me no Increase in jungle i got 0 lp in jungle and 5+ mid 5+ bot when i was playing jungle.

Can the Mastery icon for your champ be placed on the front side top left like it was before? It's one of those things that I think players would prefer seeing first rather than flipping the player card and then seeing it. Simply put, when you see the front visual of the champ with the mastery icon to its left, you just feel good...Idk how to explain it haha. I know it's a small nitpick but that's my 2 cents.

{{sticker:sg-janna}}

@Riot:  Akali was not as busted as people overhyped her to be.  People haven't even had time to learn how to play against the champion and you hammered her with nerfs every single patch.  This last nerf was going WAY too far.  If you were going to remove something, remove the heal OR the shroud.  NOT BOTH.  It was absolutely ridiculous to entirely remove her heal to begin with.  You could have reduced the heal early game.  You could have reduced the heal late game. It makes absolutely no sense for a champion that has to get in melee range to have absolutely no heal.  Not to mention her kit revolves around standing in the middle of a teamfight with people who can just mash abilities into her shroud.  I'm entirely okay with her not being able to dive tower.  Akali can't even use gunblade anymore after removing her heal entirely. Her Q with gunblade spellvamp is absolute garbage! Why can champions like zed and talon poke from a distance but also get access to lifesteal items that actually provide a decent heal late game where gunblade does not.  

Also I don't even have time to climb 5 ranked queues!  That's absolutely ridiculous.  Splashing is actually weak.  It's like a huge step backwards this patch.  I'm not happy with it.
